intro: Stellera thymelaea, commonly known as the white crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive notched or lobed appearance. Stellera thymelaea is often found in association with other early-successional plant species in its native habitat.
